alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of eastern Martin and northern Pike Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from Hode to Coal Run. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Warfield, Hode, Beauty, Lovely, Oppy, Andy, Pilgrim and Coalpoint around 730 PM EDT. Raccoon, Meta and Varney around 740 PM EDT. Kimper around 745 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Canada, Sidney, Forest Hills, Mcandrews, Huddy, Belfry, Phelps, Board Tree, Jamboree, Hardy and Majestic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
